sections.title: Passage 1 – The development of the London underground railway

questions.label: Q1
questions.prompt: What problem did the ring of overground stations create for travellers crossing the City?

questions.label: Q2
questions.prompt: Pearson believed an underground line would let workers move to new suburbs.

questions.label: Q3
questions.prompt: Approximately how long was the first planned line between Paddington and Farringdon Street?

questions.label: Q4
questions.prompt: What construction method was used to build the early tunnels?

questions.label: Q5
questions.prompt: In what year did the Metropolitan line open?

sections.title: Passage 2 – Stadiums: past, present and future

questions.label: Q6
questions.prompt: Which civilisation built the amphitheatre at Arles?

questions.label: Q7
questions.prompt: The Verona arena is now known for opera performances.

questions.label: Q8
questions.prompt: In which town is the Piazza dell’Anfiteatro located?

questions.label: Q9
questions.prompt: Modern stadiums are usually built in central city areas with mixed-use facilities.

questions.label: Q10
questions.prompt: What renewable technology on the Kaohsiung Stadium canopy generates electricity?

questions.label: Q11
questions.prompt: For how many weeks was Charles II on the run after the Battle of Worcester?

questions.label: Q12
questions.prompt: Under which type of tree did Charles II hide in Boscobel Wood?

questions.label: Q13
questions.prompt: Which diarist did Charles II ask to record his escape story?

questions.label: Q14
questions.prompt: Charles II frequently recounted his escape after he returned to the throne.

questions.label: Q15
questions.prompt: What order of chivalry did Charles II plan to commemorate his escape?
